_comment_quickcommands: double spacing is intentional, to get minecraft to sort them right
_comment4: Buttons that lead to the screen
vivecraft.options.HUD_SCALE.tooltip:
Relative size HUD takes up in field-of-view.
The units are just relative, not in degrees or a fraction of FOV or anything.
vivecraft.options.HUD_DISTANCE.tooltip:
Distance the floating HUD is drawn in front of your body.
The relative size of the HUD is unchanged by this.
Distance is in meters (though it isn't obstructed by blocks).
vivecraft.options.HUD_LOCK_TO.tooltip:
Specifies which orientation the HUD is locked to.
  Hand: The HUD will appear just above your off-hand.
  Head: The HUD will always appear in your field of view straight ahead.
  Wrist: The HUD will appear on the inside of your off-hand arm. It will "pop out" when looked at.
vivecraft.options.HUD_OPACITY.tooltip: How transparent to draw the in-game HUD and UI.
vivecraft.options.RENDER_MENU_BACKGROUND:
Specifies whether the in game GUI menus have a semi-transparent background or not.
  ON: Semi-transparent background on in-game menus.
  OFF: No background on in-game menus.
vivecraft.options.HUD_OCCLUSION.tooltip:
Specifies whether the HUD is occluded by closer objects.
  ON: The HUD will be hidden by closer objects. May be hidden completely in confined environments!
  OFF: The HUD is always visible. Stereo depth issues may be noticeable.
vivecraft.options.MENU_ALWAYS_FOLLOW_FAC:
Specifies when the main menu follows your look direction.
  Seated: The main menu will only follow in seated mode.
  Always: The main menu will always follow.
vivecraft.options.CROSSHAIR_SCALE.toolti: Sets the size of the in-game crosshair.
vivecraft.options.MENU_CROSSHAIR_SCALE.t: Sets the size of the menu crosshair.
Set the in-game crosshair display mode.
  Always: The crosshair is always shown even if the HUD is disabled.
  With HUD: The crosshair is only shown when the HUD is enabled.
  Never: The crosshair is never shown.
vivecraft.options.CHAT_NOTIFICATIONS.too:
Sets what happens when you receive a chat message.
  None: Nothing!
  Haptic: Pulse on left controller.
  Sound: Plays the Chat Notification Sound.
  Both: Both haptic and sound.
vivecraft.options.CROSSHAIR_SCALES_WITH_:
Determines how the crosshair changes with distance.
  ON: The crosshair will grow larger in the distance to remain the same apparent size from your viewpoint.
  OFF: The crosshair will always be the same size in the world and appear to shrink with distance.
vivecraft.options.RENDER_BLOCK_OUTLINE_M:
Sets the in-game block outline display mode.
  Always: The block outline is always shown even if the HUD is disabled.
  With HUD: The block outline is only shown when the HUD is enabled.
  Never: The block outline is never shown.
vivecraft.options.AUTO_OPEN_KEYBOARD.too:
If disabled, the keyboard will only open when you click a text field, or if a text field can't lose focus.

If enabled, the keyboard will open automatically any time a text field comes into focus. Enabling this will cause it to open in unwanted situations with mods.

If set to 'Chat', the keyboard will only open automatically when opening chat.
vivecraft.options.AUTO_CLOSE_KEYBOARD.to: If enabled, the keyboard will automatically close, when the screen changes.
vivecraft.options.RADIAL_MODE_HOLD.toolt:
Behavior of the radial menu when pressing the button.
  Hold: Hold radial menu button, hover over selection and release.
  Press: Press radial menu button, click buttons, press radial menu button again to dismiss.
vivecraft.options.PHYSICAL_KEYBOARD.tool:
Which type of VR keyboard to use for typing.
  Physical: A keyboard which you can type on like a real keyboard.
  Pointer: A keyboard which you can use by pointing either controller's crosshair at and pressing buttons.
vivecraft.options.PHYSICAL_KEYBOARD_SCAL: How large the physical keyboard should be, relative to its base size.
If enabled, the GUI for blocks (such as chests and furnaces) will be placed above the block. Otherwise, it will be at the usual position.
vivecraft.options.FSAA.tooltip: Uses a fancier method of resampling the game before sending it to the HMD. Works best at high render scales.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_DISPLAY.tooltip:
Mirrors image on HMD to separate desktop window.
Can be set to OFF, single or dual hmd-view, first-person undistorted, third person undistorted and mixed reality. The undistorted and mixed reality views have a performance cost.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_EYE.tooltip: Which eye to use in cropped and single modes.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_KEY_COLO: The color drawn to the "transparent" areas of the mixed reality view. Other colors in-game will be prevented from matching this so it doesn't cause weirdness.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_RENDER_H: Render hands on the mixed reality view. Only toggles rendering of the actual hand models, items will still be rendered.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_UNITY_LI: Choose between Unity-style 4-pane layout, or 2-pane side-by-side.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_UNDISTOR: Include an undistorted view in 4-pane layout. Requires an extra render pass. Otherwise the HMD view will be used.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_ALPHA_MA: In Unity layout, if yes, will draw a grayscale alpha mask to the upper-right quadrant (like Unity) for use in masking the foreground layer. Otherwise, foreground will be drawn with key color for use with color key effect.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_FOV.tool: The FOV used for the mixed reality mirror mode.
vivecraft.options.WALK_UP_BLOCKS.tooltip:
Allows you to set the ability to walk up blocks without having to jump. Hotkey: RCtrl+B
§cWARNING: May trigger anti-cheat warnings if on a multiplayer server!!
  OFF: (Default) You will have to jump up blocks.
  ON: You can walk up single blocks. May reduce locomotion induced simulator sickness for some.
vivecraft.options.MOVEMENT_MULTIPLIER.to:
Sets a movement multiplier, allowing slower movement than default. This may help reduce locomotion induced simulator sickness.
§cWARNING: May trigger anti-cheat warnings if on a multiplayer server!!
Defaults to standard Minecraft movement (1.0) speed.
vivecraft.options.INERTIA_FACTOR.tooltip:
Sets the player's movement inertia in single player mode. Lower inertia means faster acceleration, higher inertia slower acceleration. High inertia may reduce motion sickness for some, but beware of cliff edges!
  Normal: (Default) Standard Minecraft player movement.
  Automan < Normal < A lot < Even More. Does not affect lava, water or jumping movement currently.
vivecraft.options.SIMULATE_FALLING.toolt: If enabled, the player will fall to the ground in teleport mode when standing above empty space. Also allows jumping.
vivecraft.options.WEAPON_COLLISION.toolt:
Enables hitting blocks and entities in roomscale.
Auto is on in Survival and off in Creative.
vivecraft.options.FEET_COLLISION.tooltip:
Enables hitting blocks and entities in roomscale with your feet.
§6Needs Full Body Tracking to work.
§6Needs 'Weapon Collision' enabled to work.
Enables hitting blocks with swords that can be mined or instantly broken by them.
§6Has no effect when 'Weapon Collision' is disabled
vivecraft.options.ONLY_SWORD_COLLISION.t: If enabled, only swords cause block/entity damage.
vivecraft.options.REDUCED_PLAYER_REACH.t: If enabled, reduces the roomscale reach for hitting other players, to avoid accidental hits.
vivecraft.options.ALLOW_CRAWLING.tooltip: If enabled, the player will be able to duck under blocks.
vivecraft.options.LIMIT_TELEPORT.tooltip: If enabled, the arc teleporter will have restrictions in Survival mode. It will not be able to jump up the side of blocks, it will consume food, and it will have an energy bar that refills over time.
vivecraft.options.REVERSE_HANDS.tooltip:
Swap left/right hands as dominant.
  ON: Left dominant
  OFF: Right dominant

To swap the buttons, restart the game and make sure default bindings are selected in SteamVR.
vivecraft.options.REVERSE_BOW.tooltip:
Swaps the roomscale bow draw hand.
  ON: Non dominant hand draws
  OFF: Dominant hand draws

Only works if the server plugin/mod is up to date.
vivecraft.options.AIM_DEVICE.tooltip: Specifies which device to use, to aim the crosshair.
vivecraft.options.THIRDPERSON_ITEMTRANSF:
Determines how held items are transformed.
  ON: Use thirdperson transforms unmodified
  OFF: Use firstperson transforms customized

thirdperson transforms may be better for modded items.

Determines how held items with 'Custom Model Data' are transformed.
  ON: Use thirdperson transforms unmodified
  OFF: Use firstperson transforms customized
vivecraft.options.STENCIL_ON.tooltip:
Mask out areas of the screen outside the FOV.
Improves performance.
vivecraft.options.BCB_ON.tooltip:
Shows your body position as a square shadow on the ground.
This is your Square Shadow Buddy™.
Do not lose your Square Shadow Buddy.
vivecraft.options.WORLD_SCALE.tooltip:
Scales the player in the world.
Above one makes you larger
And below one makes you small
And the ones that mother gives you
don't do anything at all.
vivecraft.options.WORLD_ROTATION.tooltip:
Adds extra rotation to your HMD.
More useful bound to a button or changed with the arrow keys.
vivecraft.options.WORLD_ROTATION_INCREME: How many degrees to rotate when rotating the world.
vivecraft.options.TOUCH_HOTBAR.tooltip: If enabled, allows you to touch the hotbar with your main hand to select an item.
vivecraft.options.PLAY_MODE_SEATED.toolt:
Standing or seated play mode.
Standing is vastly superior.
vivecraft.options.RENDER_SCALEFACTOR.too: The internal rendering scale of the game, relative to the native HMD display. Higher values improve visual quality at the cost of performance.
vivecraft.options.MONO_FOV.tooltip: The FOV used for the undistorted mirror mode.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_CENTER_SMOOTH.t: Smooths the HMD position and rotation for the mirror over the given time. Reduces sudden changes and jitter.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_OPENING.tool:
If turned on, you can open doors, trapdoors and fence gates by hitting them in the opening direction.
§6Needs 'Weapon Collision' enabled to work.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_JUMP.tooltip:
If turned on, once you jump in real life your player will also jump. Also enables Jump Boots.
Auto disables jumping when Jump Boots are equipped, to prevent accidental jumps.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_SNEAK.toolti: If turned on, once you duck in real life your player will also sneak.
vivecraft.options.PHYSICAL_GUI.tooltip:
If turned on, GUIs will be replaced with 3d interactable models.
If Backpack tracking is enabled, reaching on your back will bring out your inventory bag.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_CLIMB.toolti: If turned on, allow climbing ladders and vines by touching them. Also enables Climb Claws.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_SWIM.tooltip: If turned on, allow swimming by doing the breaststroke with the controllers.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_ROW.tooltip: Row, row, row your boat... by flapping your arms like mad.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_DISMOUNT.too:
Dismounts from entities, when walking away 1 meter.
Can have issues with large modded entities.
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_BLOCK_INTERA: Allows activating levers, buttons, chests and such by holding your hand in them, and pressing the interact button
vivecraft.options.REALISTIC_ENTITY_INTER: Allows interacting with entities by holding your hand in them, and pressing the interact button
vivecraft.options.WALK_MULTIPLIER.toolti:
Multiplies your position in the room by a factor.
Allows you to walk around more, but may cause motion sickness.
vivecraft.options.FREEMOVE_MODE.tooltip:
The source for freemove direction.

  Controller: Offhand controller pointing direction.
  HMD: Headset look direction.
  Run-In-Place: Yaw is based on how controllers are swinging. Pitch is your Headset.
  Room: Yaw is relative to your VR room forward. Pitch is your Headset. This mode is best only for 180 setups.
  Waist: Yaw is based on the waist FBT tracker. Pitch is your Headset. If FBT is not available this falls back to HMD.
vivecraft.options.VEHICLE_ROTATION.toolt: Riding in a vehicle will rotate the world as the vehicle rotates. May be disorienting.
vivecraft.options.RESET_ORIGIN.tooltip: Recenter the player's feet in the world to 1.62m below the current HMD position. For non-absolute tracking systems or seated play.
vivecraft.options.X_SENSITIVITY.tooltip: Speed the view will rotate when pushed on the edge of the keyhole.
vivecraft.options.Y_SENSITIVITY.tooltip: Vertical speed of the crosshair related to the mouse.
vivecraft.options.WORLD_ROTATION_X_SENSI: Speed the view will rotate with smooth rotation.
vivecraft.options.KEYHOLE.tooltip: The number of degrees to the left and right of center where the view will begin to rotate.
vivecraft.options.FOV_REDUCTION.tooltip: Shrinks the field of view while moving. Can help with motion sickness.
vivecraft.options.FOV_REDUCTION_MIN.tool: The final size of FOV reduction.
vivecraft.options.FOV_REDUCTION_OFFSET.t: Horizontally offsets the center of the FOV reduction for non-standard HMDs.
vivecraft.options.SEATED_HMD.tooltip:
The direction the forward (W) key will go.
HMD view direction or crosshair pointing direction.
vivecraft.options.SEATED_HUD_XHAIR.toolt:
The direction the HUD will be placed.
HMD view direction or crosshair pointing direction.
vivecraft.options.BACKPACK_SWITCH.toolti: If turned on, reaching behind your head with the right controller will swap to the 1st hotbar slot, or back to the previous slot. Doing the same with the left controller will swap the left and right hand items.
vivecraft.options.ANALOG_MOVEMENT.toolti:
Walking speed will be determined by the controller button axis, if the bound button has a variable axis.

For full analog control it is better to use "Move/Strafe" or "Move/Rotate".
vivecraft.options.DIGITAL_MOVEMENT_DEADZ: Determines how far an axis input needs to be pressed in non-analog mode to trigger a movement. This is also used for 'Analog Movement' to simulate presses of the movement keys for mod compatibility.
vivecraft.options.AUTO_SPRINT.tooltip: While using freemove, sprint will automatically activate when the axis reaches the configured threshold.
The axis threshold at which auto-sprint activates.
vivecraft.options.BOW_MODE.tooltip:
Sets when to use Roomscale Archery
  OFF: Never.
  Vanilla: Only for the vanilla bow, no mod items.
  ON: Always for any item that uses the "bow" action.
vivecraft.options.TELEPORT_DOWN_LIMIT.to: Limit the number of blocks you can teleport below you.
vivecraft.options.TELEPORT_UP_LIMIT.tool: Limit the number of blocks you can teleport above you.
vivecraft.options.TELEPORT_HORIZ_LIMIT.t: Limit the number of blocks you can teleport sideways you.
vivecraft.options.ALLOW_STANDING_ORIGIN_: Allows the "Reset Origin" button to be used in standing mode, for those that wish to play physically seated while using tracked controllers.
vivecraft.options.SEATED_FREE_MOVE.toolt:
Which locomotion mode to use in seated mode.

  Teleport: Press any direction to activate.
  Free Move: WASD movement like vanilla Minecraft.
vivecraft.options.FORCE_STANDING_FREE_MO:
Forces the use of the fallback walk forwards binding (left trigger by default). For more movement options, edit the SteamVR controller bindings.

Note that this disables the teleport binding.
vivecraft.options.ALLOW_ADVANCED_BINDING:
Unhides additional SteamVR bindings for climbey, keyboard and mixed reality.

Requires a restart to take effect.
vivecraft.options.MENU_WORLD_SELECTION.t:
Which menu worlds to load on startup.

If no custom worlds are found, official worlds will be used regardless.
vivecraft.options.HRTF_SELECTION.tooltip:
HRTF profile to use for positional 3D audio. Quality may vary by device and driver.

  OFF: Explicitly disable HRTF.
  Default: Use the default HRTF profile.
  Others: Use a specific HRTF profile.
vivecraft.options.RELOAD_EXTERNAL_CAMERA: Reloads the camera config from ExternalCamera.cfg
vivecraft.options.RIGHT_CLICK_DELAY.tool: The number of game ticks between "right clicks" while holding the button down.
vivecraft.options.ANIMAL_TOUCHING.toolti:
If enabled, touching a passive mob (animal) without a weapon will right-click (interact) instead of attacking.
Turn off for Piggy Slapping, Josh.
vivecraft.options.HANDHELD_CAMERA_FOV.to: FOV of the handheld screenshot camera.
vivecraft.options.HANDHELD_CAMERA_RENDER:
Resolution of the handheld screenshot camera, for taking screenshots much larger than normal render resolution.
Cannot be used when shaders are enabled.
§cWARNING: Setting this very high may melt your computer!
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_RENDER_C: Show model of a video camera (only in HMD view) to represent where the mixed reality or third person camera is currently located. It can also be grabbed to move it around using the interact binding.
vivecraft.options.PHYSICAL_KEYBOARD_THEM: Color scheme preset for the physical keyboard. Custom theme can be edited via keyboardtheme.txt in the game directory. It will be reloaded every time the keyboard is opened, to allow real-time tweaking.
vivecraft.options.KEYBOARD_PRESS_BINDS.t:
Whether the keyboard should activate key bindings when typing into thin air.
Be careful! You might activate things you don't intend to.
vivecraft.options.CROSSHAIR_OCCLUSION.to: If enabled, the crosshair is occluded by objects when it is behind them.
vivecraft.options.HUD_HIDE.tooltip: Hides the hud during gameplay. Equivalent to pressing F1 in vanilla.
vivecraft.options.SEARCH_TYPE.tooltip:
Controls how the search field on list menus works.
 Fuzzy: Searches for close matches, allows typos.
 Exact: Searches for exact matches.
vivecraft.options.hudlock.head: Head
vivecraft.messages.seatedmode: Switching to Seated Mode will disable controller input. Continue?
vivecraft.messages.radialmenubind.1: Make sure Open Radial Menu is bound.
vivecraft.messages.radialmenubind.2: Hold (Keyboard Shift) with the radial menu open to switch to this set.
vivecraft.messages.radialmenubind.3: This is bound to the grip of the pointing controller by default.
vivecraft.messages.controls.1: Bindings are handled by SteamVR Input.
vivecraft.messages.controls.2: Go to Settings > Controllers > Manage Controller Bindings in the dashboard.
vivecraft.messages.controls.3: §6Steam must be running §obefore§r§6 SteamVR is started, or bindings will not save.
vivecraft.messages.noserverplugin: Vivecraft server mod not detected. This server may not support teleporting. Restricted movement mode (fallback to free move) has been enabled.
vivecraft.messages.calibrateheight: Please calibrate your height in the pause menu.
vivecraft.messages.intelgraphics1:
Intel Graphics are not supported on Windows because of bad drivers.

Currently used GPU: %s

Available GPUs: %s

%s
vivecraft.messages.intelgraphics2: See here how to change the used gpu: %s
vivecraft.messages.nosteamvr: OpenVR runtime not detected. Did you install SteamVR?
vivecraft.messages.outdatedsteamvr: OpenVR failed to initialize needed components. Make sure you are using the latest version of SteamVR.
vivecraft.messages.steamvrInvalidCharact:
Invalid characters in path: 
%s

To fix this error, change your Minecraft game directory to somewhere outside the folder with marked characters.
vivecraft.messages.invalidlwjgl:
Unsupported LWJGL version loaded.
Loaded version: §c%s§r
Required version: §2%s§r
Wrong LWJGL version was loaded by: %s
vivecraft.messages.menuworldexportclient: WARNING: Saving menu world using a client world. Data may be incomplete. It is recommended to save menu worlds in singleplayer.
vivecraft.messages.airtypingwarning: You are typing without a screen open. If you're trying to use key bindings, enable "Keyboard Presses Bindings" in the VR settings.
vivecraft.messages.gcinfo:
Your current garbage collector is %s, which is not optimal for Vivecraft and will likely cause hitching and framerate drops.

Your system appears sufficient to use %s and %s GB or more of heap memory, which is recommended for the smoothest experience. Add %s to your Java arguments to use it.

If you're unsure how to modify your Java arguments, press "%s" below.
_comment_m2: Buttons that lead to the screen
vivecraft.options.LOW_HEALTH_INDICATOR.t: Pulses the screen red, when at low health, to indicate your current health status.
vivecraft.options.HIT_INDICATOR.tooltip: Flashes the screen red, when taking damage.
vivecraft.options.WATER_EFFECT.tooltip: Distorts the screen, when entering/exiting water.
vivecraft.options.PORTAL_EFFECT.tooltip: Distorts the screen, when standing in a nether portal.
vivecraft.options.FREEZE_EFFECT.tooltip: Tints the screen blue, when the player is freezing.
vivecraft.options.PUMPKIN_EFFECT.tooltip: Reduces FOV with an orange border, when wearing a carved pumpkin.
vivecraft.options.SHADER_GUI_RENDER.tool:
Determines how the GUI is rendered with shaders.
  After Shader: renders the GUI without using the shader, best compatibility. (issues with PTGI HRR)
  Translucent: renders the GUI with shader and transparency. (issues with Sildurs Vibrant)
  Opaque: renders the GUI with shader and opaque
vivecraft.options.SHADER_SLOW.tooltip:
Auto: Vivecraft will try to only render the shadow pass once per frame. Some shaders need to have it ran for each eye though, so 'Auto' will render it then for every eye.
OFF: The shadow pass is always rendered.
vivecraft.options.SHADER_PATCHING.toolti: Automatically fixes known shader incompatibilities, this slows down shader loading times slightly though.
vivecraft.options.SHADER_SHADOW_MODEL_LI: Determines if the shadow of the main player model should render with full sized limbs, or equal to the first person scale.
If enabled, GUIs will be rendered at 1440p instead of 720p, greatly increasing sharpness.
May be more resource intensive on GPUs with limited memory bandwidth.
vivecraft.options.GUI_SCALE.tooltip: The GUI scale to apply when VR is active.
vivecraft.options.HUD_MAX_GUI_SCALE.tool: If enabled, the HUD will use max GUI Scale, regardless of what is set as 'VR GUI Scale'.
vivecraft.options.HUD_WRIST_OFFSET.toolt: Distance the HUD is off the arm in 'HUD Lock: Wrist' mode.
vivecraft.options.GUI_MIPMAPS.tooltip: Using Mipmaps can reduce visual aliasing on GUIs, but also make them appear blurry at shallow angles
vivecraft.options.GUI_ANISOTROPIC_FILTER:
Anisotropic Filtering reduces the blurriness of mipmaps at shallow angles.
Only active if 'Use Mipmaps' is enabled.
vivecraft.options.VR_REMEMBER_ENABLED.to: Activates VR on startup, if it was enabled the last time.
vivecraft.options.VR_PLUGIN.tooltip:
Which VR plugin to use:
  OpenVR: uses SteamVR as a backend.
  NullVR: Uses no VR Api and runs the game in VR mode without a headset.
vivecraft.options.VR_PLUGIN.disabled.too: §6Cannot be changed while VR is enabled.§r
vivecraft.options.FREEMOVE_FLY_MODE.tool:
The source for freemove direction when flying.

  Auto: uses the same direction as regular Freemove.
  Controller: Offhand controller pointing direction.
  HMD: Headset look direction.
  Waist: Yaw is based on the waist FBT tracker. Pitch is your Headset. If FBT is not available this falls back to HMD.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_UPDATES.tooltip:
How often an update message should show up in chat.
  Always: Shows the update message each time a world is loaded.
  Once: Shows the update message only on the first world load after a new update is out.
vivecraft.options.UPDATE_TYPE.tooltip: Specifies what updates should trigger a notification.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_PLUGIN.tooltip:
When the "server mod detected" message should show up in chat.
  Always: Shows the message on single/multiplayer.
  Server Only: Only shows the message in multiplayer.
  Never: Never shows the message.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_PLUGIN_MISSING.to:
How often the "server mod not detected" message should show up in chat.
  Always: Shows the message on server join and dimension/server change.
  Once: Only shows the message when joining a server.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_SERVER_VR_CHANGES:
When the message, to notify about non-default server gameplay settings, should be shown in chat.
  Always: Shows the message on single/multiplayer.
  Server Only: Only shows the message in multiplayer.
  Never: Never shows the message.
vivecraft.options.CHAT_MESSAGE_STENCIL.t: Prints a message in chat, when another mod is detected, that also uses the stencil buffer.
vivecraft.options.VR_HOTSWITCH.tooltip:
Hotswitching switches to NONVR when the headset is taken off.
If this setting is off, the game will always be in VR mode, when VR is enabled
vivecraft.options.INGAME_BINDINGS_IN_GUI: Allows for all In-Game bindings to be used in menus, this can cause unwanted double presses.
vivecraft.options.MENU_WORLD_FALLBACK.to: If Menuworlds are disabled or not loaded yet, this fallback will be shown instead.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_CROP.tooltip: Specifies how much of the VR image gets cropped. The default 15%% hides the stencil pretty good. If you play without stencil, you can reduce this, to get a bigger FOV for the mirror.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_SCREENSHOT_CAME:
If enabled, the screenshot camera will be displayed as the desktop mirror. When the camera is inactive, the currently selected mirror mode is used instead.
In mixed reality mode, only applies to the first person viewport in the Unity layout.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_OFF_TEXT.toolti: If enabled, shows a text stating that the desktop mirror is disabled.
vivecraft.options.MIRROR_GUI.tooltip:
If the GUI should be overlaid on the desktop mirror.
 OFF: Doesn't show the GUI.
 HUD Only: Only shows the GUI when no screen is open.
 Always: Always shows the GUI, even menus.
vivecraft.options.MIXED_REALITY_GUI.tool:
Specifies on which views the GUI is overlaid.
 1st Person: Shows the GUI on the first person view. (Unity only)
 3st Person: Shows the GUI on the third person view.
 Both: Shows the GUI on the first and third person view.
 Separate: Shows the GUI in the top right quadrant with the Unity layout. (Alpha Mask needs to be disabled)
vivecraft.options.RENDER_DEBUG_HEAD_HITB: If enabled, a head hitbox will be rendered for all entities when debug hitboxes are shown
vivecraft.options.RENDER_DEBUG_DEVICE_AX: If enabled, debug axes will be shown for the local players VR devices.
vivecraft.options.RENDER_DEBUG_PLAYER_AX: If enabled, debug axes will be shown for all VR players received from the server.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_PLAYER_MODEL.tool: Whether the player model should be shown in first person.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_PLAYER_MODEL_ARMS:
If the VR controller arms or the actual player model arms should be shown. Attaches the HUD to the model arm when they are shown.
 OFF: Doesn't show the model arms at all.
 Shoulders: Shows the shoulders, if the model is set to split.
 Complete: Shows the whole arms.
vivecraft.options.SHOW_PLAYER_HANDS.tool: Whether the player's hands should be shown in first person, when no player model is shown.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_MODEL_ARMS_SCAL: Scales the thickness of the first person model arms.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_MODEL_BODY_SCAL: Scales the thickness of the first person model upper body.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_MODEL_LEGS_SCAL: Scales the thickness of the first person model legs.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_MODEL_TYPE.tool:
The model type to use for all VR players:
 Vanilla: Doesn't add any new body parts and just animates the vanilla player model.
 Split arms: Splits the arms in two parts so that they can bend/separate.
 Split arms/legs: Same as 'Split arms', but also for the legs.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_LIMBS_CONNECTED: When enabled, connects the limbs of the split arms/legs model, to simulate an elbow/knee.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_LIMBS_LIMIT.too:
When enabled, arm/leg length is limited, and they stay connected.
When disabled, the arms/legs can split apart when the distance is farther than the model length.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_WALK_ANIM.toolt: Whether the Vanilla walk animation should be shown on top of feet trackers.
vivecraft.options.PLAYER_ARM_ANIM.toolti: Swings the player's arm when attacking, using items or interacting.
vivecraft.options.APPLY_PLAYER_WORLDSCAL:
Whether player models should scale with their set worldscale.
 ON: Player models will change size with the players worldscale setting.
 OFF: Player models will be default size, just the arms are at their actual position.
Shows the raw tracker positions with labels.
vivecraft.options.MAIN_PLAYER_DATA.toolt:
Determines what data is used to animate the main player model.
Realtime: Creates fresh data every frame for low latency.
Local: Interpolates the data that is sent to the server every tick.
Server: Interpolates the data received from the server, 'sendDataToOwner' needs to be enabled on the server for this.
vivecraft.options.STENCIL_BUFFER_DISABLE: When enabled, the eye stencil just draws the black overlay, without using a stencil buffer. Enable this when the eye stencil is causing issues with mods, and you want to keep the eye stencil enabled.
vivecraft.options.RADIAL_NUMBER.tooltip: Number of buttons available in the radial menu.
When enabled, closes the game when the VR runtime closes/crashes.
When disabled, keeps the game open and just disables VR mode.
vivecraft.options.OSC_TRACKER_PORT.toolt: Network Port used to receive FBT data from other applications over the OSC protocol.
vivecraft.options.MODIFY_PAUSE_MENU.tool:
When enabled, adds additional buttons to the pause menu for ease of use.
When disabled, the pause menu stays untouched
vivecraft.options.screen.blocklist.toolt: List of servers that will only be joinable when VR is disabled. All Vivecraft functionality will be disabled while playing on a server that is on this list.
vivecraft.options.RENDER_DEBUG_GAMEPLAY_: If enabled, shows some debug info for gameplay trackers that are used for roomscale actions.
vivecraft.options.GAMEPLAY_TRACKER_TO_RE: Determines which gameplay tracker should show debug info.
vivecraft.options.CONTROLLER_TRANSFORM.t:
Determines which rotation transforms the controllers should use.
AUTO will ask the VR Runtime for the rotation transforms.
vivecraft.options.FULL_RELOAD_ON_INIT.to:
Forces a full resource reload when toggling VR, at the cost of longer wait times.
This can fix some issues with Mods that reinitialize some stuff only on a full resource reload.
vivecraft.options.FEET_BODY_POSITION.too:
When enabled, the player position will use the average of the feet FBT trackers that are near the ground.
 When disabled (or without FBT trackers), the player position will use the head position.
vivecraft.messages.novrhotswitchinglegac: Legacy Vivecraft server mod detected. This Server does not support VR hot switching, you can only change it in the main menu.
vivecraft.messages.novrhotswitching: This Server has VR hot switching disabled, you can only change it in the main menu.
vivecraft.messages.vrhotswitchinginfo: VR Hotswitching enabled: Put on your headset to switch to VR
vivecraft.messages.noheadaimserverplugin: This server uses an older Vivecraft server mod. This will cause 'Controller Aim' to be forced for certain items.
vivecraft.messages.updateAvailable: §a[Vivecraft]§r Update available: %s. click for more details.
vivecraft.messages.optifineaa: Optifine antialiasing is not compatible with VR. To use VR disable antialiasing and restart the game.
vivecraft.messages.stencil:
§a[Vivecraft]§r A different mod uses the stencil buffer, if you run into weird rendering issues, try disabling the Eye Stencil in: %s
You can disable this message in: %s
vivecraft.messages.slowshader: §a[Vivecraft]§r The selected shader uses features, that need the shadows to be processed for every render pass. §6This might be slow.§r
vivecraft.messages.menuworldshaderdisabl: §a[Vivecraft]§r Temporarily disabling shaders to load the Menuworld.
vivecraft.messages.blocklist.title: Server is on the Vivecraft Server Blocklist
vivecraft.messages.blocklist:
The selected Server '%s' is on the Vivecraft Server Blocklist.
Continuing to join will completely disable Vivecraft.
vivecraft.messages.fabulousFailed: §a[Vivecraft]§r §cFabulous VR shader failed to compile, check the log for the full error.
vivecraft.message.worldscaleOutOfRange.t: Total VR world scale out of range
vivecraft.message.worldscaleOutOfRange:
World Scale is limited by the server from %1$s to %2$s.
To play on this server, reset the world scale in %3$s to §a1x§r.
vivecraft.messages.fbtcalibration:
Look forward and stand straight up with the feet together.
Then hold your arms to the side, until they show as §2green§r.
Then press the interact key on both controllers to confirm.
(by default bound to the triggers)
vivecraft.messages.fbtcalibration.unlabe: §6Unlabeled Trackers in use, calibration will be temporary!

§6Unlabeled Trackers used!
Check that the trackers got assigned correctly before confirming!
vivecraft.messages.calibratefbtchat: FBT trackers detected, but not calibrated. To use them, calibrate them in the pause menu.
vivecraft.messages.steamvrnotfound: SteamVR couldn't be found, make sure it is installed.
vivecraft.messages.steamvrrunningflatpak: You seem to be running Minecraft with a launcher that is installed with flatpak. Because of flatpak isolation, they can't talk to SteamVR, so try switching to a launcher that is installed without flatpak.
vivecraft.messages.serversettingsnotavai:
§6You are currently playing on a server. Server settings can only be changed on the client that is hosting the game.§r
§6If you are an OP you can use the '/vivecraft-server-config' command on servers with vivecraft to change options.§r

§6This is a server setting and can only be adjusted in singleplayer.§r
§6If you are an OP you can use the '/vivecraft-server-config' command on servers with vivecraft to change it.§r
vivecraft.messages.nondefaultvrchanges: §a[Vivecraft]§r This server has some gameplay settings set to non-default values. %s
vivecraft.messages.noteleport: This server has teleporting explicitly disabled. Restricted movement mode (fallback to free move) has been enabled.
vivecraft.messages.shifttopickcolor: Hold shift when clicking a key to pick its color.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.deathB: Seated VR Death by Mob Message
Non Vivecraft Death by Mob Message
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.VRvsVR: Allow Standing VR vs Standing VR Damage
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.SEATEDVRvsS: Allow Seated VR vs Seated VR Damage
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.VRvsSEATEDV: Allow Standing VR vs Seated VR Damage
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.VRvsNONVR: Allow Standing VR vs NonVR Damage
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.SEATEDVRvsN: Allow Seated VR vs NonVR Damage
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.debug.t: Will log clients that connect with Vivecraft and their Vivecraft version.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.checkFo: Will check for new mod versions when an OP logs into the server and sends a system message to them.

What updates to check for.
 r: Release, b: Beta, a: Alpha
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.vr_only:
Set to 'true' to only allow VR players to join the server.
 If enabled, VR hotswitching will be automatically disabled.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.vive_on: Set to 'true' to only allow players that have Vivecraft installed to join the server.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.allow_o: Set to 'true', to allow server OPs to bypass VR/Vivecraft only settings.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.message:
Seconds to wait before kicking a player or sending the welcome messages.
 The player's client must send the Vivecraft VERSION info in this time.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.vrFun.t: Gives VR Players fun cakes and drinks at random, when they respawn.
vivecraft.serverSettings.general.sendDat:
Sends the player position data also back to the player that sent it, usually not needed.
 Enable this on a dedicated server when using replay mod or something similar.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.toolti: Configure messages that are sent when players do specific actions.

Set message to nothing to not send. e.g., leaveMessage = ""
 Use '%s' in any message for the player name.
 For messages that take two placeholders (i.e., death by mob) use '%1$s' for the player name and '%2$s' for the second placeholder.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.welcom: Message sent when a player joins with VR active.
Message sent when a player joins with VR not active.
Message sent when a player joins with VR in seated mode.
Message sent when a player joins without vivecraft installed.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.leaveM: Message sent when a player leaves the server.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.KickVi: Message sent to a player when they get kicked because of the 'Vivecraft Only' setting.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.KickVR: Message sent to a player when they get kicked because of the 'VR Only' setting.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.deathV: Message sent when a player dies with VR active.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.deathN: Message sent when a player dies with VR not active.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.deathS: Message sent when a player dies with VR in seated mode.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.deathV: Message sent when a player dies without Vivecraft.
vivecraft.serverSettings.messages.deathB: Message sent when a player dies because of a mob with VR active.
Message sent when a player dies because of a mob with VR not active.
Message sent when a player dies because of a mob with VR in seated mode.
Message sent when a player dies because of a mob without Vivecraft.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.creep:
Distance at which creepers swell and explode for standing VR players.
 Vanilla distance: 3
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.mobAt:
Adjusts the range in which mobs can use melee attacks against standing VR players.
 This is a reduction to the vanilla range (0.8 blocks), so 0.0 causes no change, and -0.7 means the mobs need to almost touch the player to cause an attack.
 When set very low, mobs might stop right in front of the player without attacking!
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.dualW: Allows vr players to hit/mine with their non-dominant hand items.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.boots:
Melee damage addition for VR players when hitting with their feet.
 This scales with the armor attribute of the boots, doing one additional damage per Armor level, times this multiplier
 Set to 0.0 to disable.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.proje:
Projectiles by default have an inaccuracy to not shoot in the same direction all the time.
 With this, the inaccuracy can be adjusted for VR players.
 1.0 is equal to vanilla, 0.0 is no inaccuracy at all.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.allow: Allows VR players to bypass the vanilla block breaking check, which prevents breaking blocks too fast.
Allows VR players to block attacks by holding their shield up, without needing to actively use it. This means they can block attacks without needing to slow down.
Allows VR players to attack entities, while they are actively using a shield. (This setting does not affect roomscale shield blocking)
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.bow.s:
Archery damage multiplier for VR players in standing mode.
 Set to 1.0 to disable.

Archery damage multiplier for VR players in seated mode.
 Set to 1.0 to disable.

Headshot damage multiplier for VR players in standing mode.
 Set to 1.0 to disable.

Headshot damage multiplier for VR players in seated mode.
 Set to 1.0 to disable.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.bow.v:
Headshot damage multiplier for Vanilla/NonVR players.
 Set to 1.0 to disable.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrChanges.bow.h:
Indicator to notify players that they got a headshot. Options are:
 "NONE": No indicator.
 "AUDIO": Plays a sound near the shooter.
 "VISUAL": Spawns particles at the hit location.
 "BOTH": Both Audio and Visual indicators.
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.notifyBlock: Notifies the player that tried to cause damage, that it was blocked from the server.
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.VRvsVR.tool: Allows Standing VR players to damage each other.
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.SEATEDVRvsS: Allows Seated VR players to damage each other.
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.VRvsSEATEDV: Allows Standing VR players and Seated VR Players to damage each other.
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.VRvsNONVR.t: Allows Standing VR players and Non VR players to damage each other.
vivecraft.serverSettings.pvp.SEATEDVRvsN: Allows Seated VR players and Non VR players to damage each other.
vivecraft.serverSettings.climbey.enabled: Allows the use of 'Jump Boots' and 'Climb Claws'.
vivecraft.serverSettings.climbey.blockmo:
Specifies how the blocks in the blocklist are interpreted. Options are:
 "DISABLED": List is ignored. All blocks are climbable.
 "WHITELIST": Only blocks on the list are climbable.
 "BLACKLIST": All blocks are climbable except those on the list
vivecraft.serverSettings.climbey.blockli:
List of block names for use with WHITELIST/BLACKLIST block mode.
 Blocks can be of the form 'blockid' for vanilla or 'modid:blockid' for modded blocks
vivecraft.serverSettings.crawling.enable: Allows VR players to get into the crawl state by getting low to the ground. Disabling does not prevent vanilla crawling.
vivecraft.serverSettings.teleport.enable:
Allows VR players to use teleport movement. It is recommended to leave this enabled for players prone to VR sickness.
 Disabling this only works for Vivecraft 1.3.0+ clients.
vivecraft.serverSettings.teleport.limite: Enforces limited teleport range and frequency in Survival.
vivecraft.serverSettings.teleport.upLimi: Maximum number of blocks players in Survival mode can teleport up. Set to 0 to disable.
vivecraft.serverSettings.teleport.downLi: Maximum number of blocks players in Survival mode can teleport down. Set to 0 to disable.
vivecraft.serverSettings.teleport.horizo: Maximum number of blocks players in Survival mode can teleport horizontally. Set to 0 to disable.
vivecraft.serverSettings.worldScale.limi: Limit the range of worldscales players are allowed to use.
vivecraft.serverSettings.settingOverride: Forces players to use the 'Raw Item Positions' setting
Forces players to use the 'Raw Item Positions' setting, only for items with custom model data/custom item models.
vivecraft.serverSettings.vrSwitching.ena:
Allows players to switch between VR and NonVR on the fly.
 If disabled, they will be locked to the mode they joined with.
vivecraft.serverSettings.debug.debugPart: Will spawn particles at VR players device positions, to indicate the server VR data state.
Will spawn particles at VR players head position, to indicate the server VR data state.
